snippet: Brian M. McLaughlin, a former state assemblyman and labor council head, was praised for cooperating with federal investigations that resulted in several corruption convictions.
abstract: Brian M McLaughlin, former New York State assemblyman and labor council head who is serving prison sentence for stealing from his campaign, state government and labor unions, is praised by prosecutors for cooperating with federal investigations that resulted in bribery or corruption convictions for State Sen Carl Kruger and other state officials; as reward, McLaughlin's sentence is reduced to six years from original term of 10.
lead_paragraph: Brian M. McLaughlin, a former state assemblyman and labor council head, was praised for cooperating with federal investigations that resulted in several corruption convictions.

headline.main: Prison Time That Ex-Legislator Must Serve Is Reduced
headline.print_headline: Prison Time Ex-Legislator Must Serve Is Reduced
